about_me.title: About me
about_me.cv_summary: Software Engineer specialized in .NET and Angular technologies with 10 years of professional experience in the industry. Strong ability to analyze and solve problems to design robust, scalable, and secure systems by applying various software architectures that ensure system performance and scalability. I possess a solid understanding of software design patterns, object-oriented programming, and other software development principles such as S.O.L.I.D.; along with experience in agile project management. Proven ability to lead development teams and work closely with various stakeholders to deliver innovative software products on schedule. Proactive in adopting new technologies and agile methodologies; with a constant focus on continuous improvement. I am also familiar with DevOps concepts and continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD).

skills.backend_description:
My knowledge as a backend developer is strongly linked to the .NET ecosystem, especially in developing robust and scalable Web APIs based on .NET (versions 3.1, 6, 7, and 8), implementing advanced architectures such as Clean Architecture, Vertical Slice Architecture, N-Layer Architecture, and Domain-Driven Design (DDD) along with design patterns like S.O.L.I.D., Dependency Injection (DI), CQRS with the MediatR library, Caching, Publish/Subscribe with RabbitMQ and the MassTransit library, and Api Gateway.

I have worked extensively with various libraries and tools in the .NET ecosystem, including MediatR for mediation and handling commands and queries, FluentValidation for data validation, and Swagger for API documentation. Additionally, I have solid experience using ORMs such as Entity Framework Core and the LINQ query language for efficient data manipulation.

In projects I have participated in, I have also implemented caching mechanisms with Redis and asynchronous messaging systems with RabbitMQ, ensuring efficient communication between services. Regarding security and authentication, I have used JWT and managed identity providers like Identity Server 4 and Keycloak.

Lastly, I also have knowledge in containerization and orchestration of services with Docker and Docker-Compose.
skills.frontend_description:
Regarding web application development, I have extensive experience using the Angular framework from version 10 onwards. These applications are structured with an N-Layer architecture, separating the data model layer from the service layer, which is responsible for fetching data from APIs and returning it to the presentation layer that displays and formats the data accordingly.

Among the technical aspects, I can mention the implementation of multiple modules and routing through lazy loading for optimized performance, both framework-specific and custom directives, pipes, RxJS, and Reactive Forms for reactive programming, multiple languages using i18n libraries, interceptors for handling HTTP requests and errors, route protection, screens and components using permission management libraries, and the implementation of responsive designs using Tailwind CSS and Material Design to ensure that applications are not only functional but also visually appealing and provide a good user experience.

about_this_project.title: About this project
about_this_project.description:
This project was developed using the following technologies:

Backend

The purpose of the backend of this project is to validate that the token generated by Google reCAPTCHA is a valid token and to send the contact email. Although these two functionalities are simple to implement, I decided to structure the project using the following features so that its source code serves as supporting documentation of my knowledge:
  • .NET 8
  • Clean Architecture
  • Domain-Driven Design (DDD)
  • CQRS
  • MediatR
  • Exception Handlers
  • Logging Behaviors
  • Validation Behaviors
  • FluentValidation
  • DI
  • Mapster
  • Swagger
Source code on GitHub: Me.Cv

Frontend

The frontend was developed using the following features:
  • Angular 16
  • TypeScript
  • SASS (.scss)
  • Angular Flex-Layout (currently deprecated, will soon be migrated to Tailwind CSS)
  • Material Icons
  • Moment.js
  • i18n (ngx-translate)
  • Pipes
  • Google reCAPTCHA
Source code on GitHub: Me.Cv.Web

Deployment

The deployment was carried out on a Debian 12 server (on Digital Ocean) with Nginx, Let's Encrypt for SSL certificate management, and Nic.Ar to configure the site's domain.

Version Control System

GIT and GitHub
